root_causes: Sum validation (B2cx1_sum <> S7_1) is performed unconditionally when S7_1 is present; missing the required DK handling specified in the question ValidationCode.
The generated code does not call/run CheckDK3D('B2cx1','B2cDKx1') or check that no DKs were selected (f('B2cDKx1').size() == 0) before performing the validateB1c-style sum comparison.
instructions: Implement the DK handling and guard the sum validation with it. Specifically, run CheckDK3D('B2cx1','B2cDKx1') and only perform the comparison of B2cx1_sum to S7_1 when there are no DK selections (i.e. when f('B2cDKx1').size() == 0) and there are no question errors.

Modify the existing selection for the sum check (currently: sel if ~miss(S7_1) and (B2cx1_sum <> S7_1)) to include the DK/no-errors guard. Example logical form: only flag records where (no DK selected for B2cx1) AND (~miss(S7_1)) AND (B2cx1_sum <> S7_1).

Ensure the CheckDK3D call is executed before the sum-check and that the code respects the ValidationCode semantics (i.e., do not validate sums when DK/Other conditions indicate the respondent used DK/other responses).

root_causes: Sum validation (B2cx2_sum <> S7_2) is performed without checking DK selection state, whereas the expected logic requires checking DK via CheckDK3D('B2cx2','B2cDKx2').
Missing guard to only validate when no DK selected (f('B2cDKx2').size() == 0) and no QuestionErrors.
instructions: Add DK handling prior to sum validation: execute CheckDK3D('B2cx2','B2cDKx2') and only perform the B2cx2_sum vs S7_2 comparison when there are no DK selections (f('B2cDKx2').size() == 0) and no question errors.
Change the current sel if for the sum-check (sel if ~miss(S7_2) and (B2cx2_sum <> S7_2)) to include the DK/no-errors condition so that sums are not validated when DK/Other are present.
Make the implementation consistent with the ValidationCode: call CheckDK3D first and then conditionally call/perform the validateB1c-like check only when appropriate.

root_causes: Sum validation (B2cx3_sum <> S7_3) is executed without the DK check required by the question ValidationCode (CheckDK3D('B2cx3','B2cDKx3')).
No guard to ensure the sum validation runs only when no DKs are selected (f('B2cDKx3').size() == 0) and when there are no question errors.
instructions: Invoke CheckDK3D('B2cx3','B2cDKx3') before performing any sum-validation and ensure the sum comparison (B2cx3_sum <> S7_3) only runs when there are no DK selections (f('B2cDKx3').size() == 0) and no QuestionErrors.
Replace the unconditional selector (sel if ~miss(S7_3) and (B2cx3_sum <> S7_3)) with a conditional that includes the DK/no-errors guard to match the ValidationCode behavior.
Ensure the code path mirrors the ValidationCode: CheckDK3D; if no question errors and no DK selections then perform validateB1c-style sum validation.

root_causes: Missing expected validation logic: CheckDK3D('A4x1','A4DKx1') is not called.
Missing subsequent validation when the multi question is answered: the expected CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars") are not implemented.

Selection logic uses a generic string non-empty check (v <> "") which may not correctly detect coded numeric selections for the sub-items; it does not distinguish between coded choices and open-text responses.
Does not handle the specified DK variable (A4DKx1) or the MultiItemsSelectedMinimum requirement and related validation semantics from the expected ValidationCode.
instructions: Implement the DK validation call: include CheckDK3D('A4x1','A4DKx1') before other checks so the DK option is processed per expected logic.
When any of the multi items is answered, execute the multi open-text validations exactly as expected: call CheckMultiOpenD1() and then CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars").

Replace the generic DO REPEAT string emptiness test with checks appropriate to the variable types: for coded (numeric) sub-items use NOT MISSING(A4x1_1) etc. For open-text sub-items use STRING length checks (e.g. CHAR.LENGTH > 0 or TRIM() <> "").

Ensure the MultiItemsSelectedMinimum behavior is enforced: explicitly validate that at least one coded item or allowed open response is present unless DK is selected. If DK (A4DKx1) is present, skip the minimum-selection error.

Include handling for 'AutoCheckOther' if any 'Other' open response exists (apply same open-text length check and check that 'Other' code is consistent with open text), matching the expected validation behavior.

root_causes: Does not enforce the MultiItemsSelectedMinimum=1 requirement (no check that at least one of A4x1_1..A4x1_5 equals 1).
ValidationCode CheckDK3D('A4x1','A4DKx1') is not implemented (no DK/don't-know consistency checks involving A4DKx1).
Open-text validation directives (CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(...)) are not implemented; no checks for presence/length of open-ended responses when an open option is selected.
instructions: Add a validation that flags when none of the multi items are selected. Example approach: temporary; sel if ~any(A4x1_1, A4x1_2, A4x1_3, A4x1_4, A4x1_5, 1). list respid. This will enforce MultiItemsSelectedMinimum = 1.

Implement the CheckDK3D('A4x1','A4DKx1') logic: ensure consistency between DK/other special-code variable A4DKx1 and the individual item flags. For example, flag cases where A4DKx1 indicates a DK/NA code but any A4x1_* = 1, or where A4DKx1 is blank but a DK code appears in any A4x1_* (use the actual DK code values used in the dataset).

Add open-text validations called by CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE: when the open/Other option is selected, require the corresponding open-text variable(s) to be non-missing and within the allowed length. Concretely, identify the open-end variable(s) associated with A4x1 (e.g., A4x1_OE or the platform-specific OE variable), then sel if any(A4x1_<other_code_vars>,1) and (miss(A4x1_OE) or length(A4x1_OE) > <max_chars>) to flag missing or too-long responses.

Retain the per-subvariable invalid-code check (the existing ~any(v,0,1) is fine), but combine it with the additional checks above so all expected ValidationCode rules (minimum selection, DK handling, and OE checks) are enforced.
